results.title: Exercise versus Metformin to Improve Pregnancy Outcomes among Overweight Pregnant Women: A Systematic Review and Network Meta-Analysis
results.text_hl: Previous meta-analyses estimated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduced @<m>DISEASE_Gestational_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000078064 @@@MWG@@@ by 1.35 to 1.49 kg, whereas the previous NMA found no effect.

citations.NLM: Pascual-Morena C, Cavero-Redondo I, Álvarez-Bueno C, Lucerón-Lucas-Torres M, Sanabria-Martínez G, Poyatos-León R, Rodríguez-Martín B, Martínez-Vizcaíno V. Exercise versus Metformin to Improve Pregnancy Outcomes among Overweight Pregnant Women: A Systematic Review and Network Meta-Analysis J Clin Med. 2021 Aug 7;10(16):. PMID: 34441786
citations.BibTeX: @article{34441786, title={Exercise versus Metformin to Improve Pregnancy Outcomes among Overweight Pregnant Women: A Systematic Review and Network Meta-Analysis}, author={Pascual-Morena C and Cavero-Redondo I and Álvarez-Bueno C and Lucerón-Lucas-Torres M and Sanabria-Martínez G and Poyatos-León R and Rodríguez-Martín B and Martínez-Vizcaíno V}, journal={J Clin Med}, volume={10}, number={16}}

results.title: Impact of metformin treatment during pregnancy on maternal outcomes: a systematic review/meta-analysis
results.text_hl: Thirty-five studies (n = 8033 pregnancies) met eligibility criteria. @<m>DISEASE_Gestational_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000078064 @@@GWG@@@ was lower in pregnancies randomised to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ versus other treatments (1.57 kg +- 0.60 kg; I2 = 86%, p < 0.0001), as was likelihood of @DISEASE_Pre_Eclampsia @DISEASE_MESH:D011225 @@@pre-eclampsia@@@ (OR 0.69, 95% CI 0.50-0.95; I2 = 55%, p = 0.02).

citations.NLM: Tarry-Adkins JL, Ozanne SE, Aiken CE. Impact of metformin treatment during pregnancy on maternal outcomes: a systematic review/meta-analysis Sci Rep. 2021 Apr 29;11(1):9240. PMID: 33927270
citations.BibTeX: @article{33927270, title={Impact of metformin treatment during pregnancy on maternal outcomes: a systematic review/meta-analysis}, author={Tarry-Adkins JL and Ozanne SE and Aiken CE}, journal={Sci Rep}, volume={11}, number={1}, pages={9240}}

results.title: Prevention of Excessive Gestational Weight Gain and Postpartum Weight Retention.
results.text_hl: Among the pharmacologic agents, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ has been shown to reduce @<m>DISEASE_Gestational_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000078064 @@@GWG@@@.

citations.NLM: Nicodemus NA Jr. Prevention of Excessive Gestational Weight Gain and Postpartum Weight Retention. Curr Obes Rep. 2018 Jun;7(2):105-111. PMID: 29696560
citations.BibTeX: @article{29696560, title={Prevention of Excessive Gestational Weight Gain and Postpartum Weight Retention.}, author={Nicodemus NA Jr}, journal={Curr Obes Rep}, volume={7}, number={2}, pages={105-111}}

results.title: Metformin in overweight and obese women with gestational diabetes: a propensity score-matched study.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Women@@@ in @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group had significantly less excessive @<m>DISEASE_Gestational_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000078064 @@@GWG@@@ (29.23% vs. 42.31%, OR 0.56, 95% CI 0.34-0.94, p = 0.028) and more adequate @<m>DISEASE_Gestational_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000078064 @@@GWG@@@ (36.92% vs. 23.08%, OR 1.95, 95% CI 1.14-3.35, p = 0.015).

citations.NLM: Bettencourt-Silva R, Neves JS, Ferreira MJ, Souteiro P, Belo S, Oliveira AI, Carvalho D, Namora G, Montenegro N, Queirós J. Metformin in overweight and obese women with gestational diabetes: a propensity score-matched study. Endocrine. 2019 Nov;66(2):192-200. PMID: 31401725
